cab.content:
(This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty's Government.)
G.T.5840
SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - EVENING - 30th SEPTEMBER, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
British Front.
On the YPRES Front, the line runs WARNETON - COMINES - WERVICQ - GHELUWE (Inclusive) - DADIZEELE - ST. PIETER - E. of MOORSLEDE - VIERKAVENHOEK - STADEN - KRUISSTRAAT -WERKEN.
It is reported that our advanced troops have reached ROULERS.
On the ST.QUENTIN-CAMBRAI Front, we have taken CRAVECOEUR and VILLERS-GUISLAIN. The enemy hold RUMILLY. North of CAMBRAI we have taken BLECOURT and TILLOY. Otherwise there is no change reported.
French Front.
Between the AISNE and the VESLE the French attacked this morning and have taken PROUILLY, MONTIGNY, ROMAIN, GLENNES, REVILL0N. The line North of the AISNE runs MOISSY - BRAYE - CHAVIGNON.
They have taken over 2,000 prisoners.
On the ARGONNE Front, the French have reached the Southern outskirts of MONTHOIS and have taken MARVAUX.
2. MACEDONIAN FRONT.
The advance on USKUB continues and French troops have reached CRENAVODA and TELEGRAD, also their infantry are at GOMALEVO.
3. ITALIAN AND PALESTINE FRONTS.
There is nothing to report.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
30th September, 1918.
Issued at 6.50 p.m.
